Class Element

java.lang.Object
train.Element
Direct Known Subclasses:
Section, Station
public abstract class Element extends Object
Cette classe abstraite est la représentation générique d'un élément de base d'un circuit, elle factorise les fonctionnalitÃ©s communes des deux sous-classes : l'entrée d'un train, sa sortie et l'appartenance au circuit.
Les deux sous-classes sont :
  1. La représentation d'une gare : classe Station
  2. La représentation d'une section de voie ferrée : classe Section
Author:
Fabien Dagnat invalid input: '<'fabien.dagnat@imt-atlantique.fr>, Philippe Tanguy invalid input: '<'philippe.tanguy@imt-atlantique.fr> Authors of the new implementation, Othmane EL AKRABA invalid input: '<'othmane.el-akraba@imt-atlantique.net>, Soufiane LACHGUER invalid input: '<'soufiane.lachguer@imt-atlantique.net>

    Method
    Description
    void
    enter(Direction d)
    Method that changes the status of the element to be occupied and notifies all the trains of the change.

    Returns an array that contains the adjacent elements (sections or railways)

    getIsOccupied()
    Returns whether the element is occupied of not
    Railway
    getRailway()
    Returns the railway that the element belongs to
    boolean
    invariant(Direction d)
    Method that encodes the invariant conditions, i.e : - if the element isn't occupied, and - the train is entering from the same direction as the railway's direction Returns the verification status of the invariant

    Method that changes the status of the element to be free and notifies all the trains of the change

  • Constructor Details

    • Element

      protected Element(String name)
      Constructor that initializes an element with a name. If a name isn't given, it will throw a NullPointerException.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the Element

  • Method Details

    • setRailway

      public void setRailway(Railway r)
      Method that appoints an element to a specific railway. If the railway isn't given, it will throw a NullPointerException.
      Parameters:
      r - The railway to be assigned to

    • getIsOccupied

      public boolean getIsOccupied()
      Returns whether the element is occupied of not
      Returns:
      Boolean informing whether the element is occupied or not

    • setIsOccupied

      public void setIsOccupied(boolean b)
      Changes the status of the element (the boolean isOccupied) and notifies all trains on the railway
      Parameters:
      b - The new value of the boolean isOccupied

    • getRailway

      public Railway getRailway()
      Returns the railway that the element belongs to
      Returns:
      The railway that the element belongs to

    • leave

      public void leave()
      Method that changes the status of the element to be free and notifies all the trains of the change

    • enter

      public void enter(Direction d)
      Method that changes the status of the element to be occupied and notifies all the trains of the change. Note that the train can only enter if the invariant is verified (and that the invariant depends on the direction of the entering train) If the train can't verify the invariant, the train is made to wait.
      Parameters:
      d - The direction of the entering train

    • invariant

      public boolean invariant(Direction d)
      Method that encodes the invariant conditions, i.e : - if the element isn't occupied, and - the train is entering from the same direction as the railway's direction Returns the verification status of the invariant
      Parameters:
      d - The direction of the entering train
      Returns:
      Boolean that encodes the verification status of the invariant

    • getAdjacent

      public Element[] getAdjacent()
      Returns an array that contains the adjacent elements (sections or railways)
      Returns:
      Array that contains the adjacent elements (sections or railways)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String containing the name of the element
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
